title: Two Indicators shaking China's economy
description: Xi Jinping recently secured his third term as China's president – so we're looking at two shocks to the world's second-largest economy. First: How China's housing boom turned into a real estate crisis. Second: How the recent U.S. ban on selling advanced semiconductor chips to China could affect China's technology industry.

itunes:title: Two Indicators shaking China's economy
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Why China's housing market went from boom to bust, and how the new ban on selling high-end semiconductor chips to China may affect its tech sector
itunes:subtitle: Why China's housing market went from boom to bust, and how the new ban on selling high-end semiconductor chips to China may affect its tech sector
